question.title: Jenkins Agent Disconnects with ClosedChannelException Despite Using Java 17 and JNLP/WebSocket
question.body:
I'm facing a persistent issue with a Jenkins agent (Test_Node) disconnecting during pipeline execution. The error in the logs is:

java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException
hudson.remoting.ChannelClosedException: Channel "hudson.remoting.Channel@...": Remote call on 
Test_Node failed. The channel is closing down or has closed down
at hudson.model.Computer.recordTermination(Computer.java:242)
06:21:26        at hudson.model.Computer.disconnect(Computer.java:512)
06:21:26        at hudson.slaves.SlaveComputer.disconnect(SlaveComputer.java:816)
06:21:26        at hudson.slaves.ChannelPinger$1.onDead(ChannelPinger.java:192)
06:21:26        at hudson.remoting.PingThread.ping(PingThread.java:132)
06:21:26        at hudson.remoting.PingThread.run(PingThread.java:88)"

Environment:

Jenkins version: 2.462.1

Java 17 on both controller and agent

Agent running as webservice on windows machine

Connection method: WebSocket

Plugins: Matlab Plugin, OpenTelemetry, etc

Question: What else could be causing the ClosedChannelException even after aligning Java versions? Are there known issues with specific plugins (e.g., Matlab or OpenTelemetry) or Jetty WebSocket handling in Jenkins?
